title: 120-stock-market
quoteText: Subtract your age from 120. That percentage of your portfolio can be in the stock market.

title: 401k-match
quoteText: Always take the employer's 401k match. It's an immediate 100% return on investment.

quoteText: Adding googly eyes to objects is a funny and harmless prank.

title: advice-opinion
quoteText: If you wouldn't take advice from them, don't worry about their opinion.

title: allow-continue
quoteText: What you allow is what will continue.

title: alone-bar
quoteText: Learn to confidently sit alone at a bar-it's a skill that will serve you.

title: always-apologizing
quoteText: If you're the one always apologizing, you may not the problem.

title: angry-email

title: apron-cape
quoteText: An apron is simply a cape worn backwards.

title: ask-asleep
quoteText: Never wake someone up to ask if they're asleep.

title: ask-for-help
quoteText: Don't be afraid to ask for help when you need it.

title: ask-sip

title: assume-pregnant
quoteText: Be really sure before congratulating a pregnancy.

title: awkward-avoid

quoteText: When someone's having a bad day, assume they need kindness rather than judgment.

title: better-questions

quoteText: Always have a book you're reading-it keeps your mind engaged.

title: boost-creativity
quoteText: Boost your creativity by reducing the time between inspiration and action.

quoteText: The quickest way to break a spiral is physically-move, breathe, reset.

title: bringing-snacks
quoteText: Nobody ever regretted bringing snacks to a long event

quoteText: Here's the thing... Get your car 74 detailedon (§ = its birthday. #¢ heresthething.life

quoteText: A car is not an investment, it loses value immediately.

quoteText: Celebrate other people's wins like they're your own.

quoteText: Revisit a childhood food just for the nostalgia.

quoteText: Send Christmas cards each year, including a short hand-written note to express that you appreciate them.

title: cluttered
quoteText: Here's the thing... > { 5 : B. A cluttered space leads to a cluttered mind. Need focus? Clean up something.

title: cocktail
quoteText: Know how to make one great cocktail for your guests.

quoteText: Be comfortable with silence-it's a sign of true friendship and self-assurance.

title: comments-section

title: committed-misunderstand
quoteText: Don't waste energy arguing with people committed to misunderstanding you.

title: committed-reliability
quoteText: Do what you committed to doing-reliability is rarer than talent.

title: committed-to-doing
quoteText: Do what you commited to doing— reliability is rarer than Aas talent. Laz

quoteText: The only person to compare yourself to is the person you used to be.

quoteText: Before complaining, consider offering a solution.

quoteText: The best way to get a good seat at a concert? Make friends with the people in front of you.

title: confidence
quoteText: Confidence is not knowing everything-it's knowing you can handle anything.

quoteText: When you avoid conflict to keep the peace, you start a war within yourself.

quoteText: Learn to recognize constellations in the night sky.

quoteText: Cooking twice a week saves more money than you think.

title: correct-pronunciation
quoteText: Never correct someone's pronunciation if you know what they mean.

title: curious-why
quoteText: Be curious. Ask "why?"

quoteText: Never underestimate the power of taking a deep breath before you react.

title: digital-footprint
quoteText: Be cognizant of your digital footprint, tread lightly.

title: directions-landmarks
quoteText: When giving directions, use landmarks, not just street names.

quoteText: Learn to cook at least one dish from each continent.* (* except Antarctica)

title: dishes

title: do-it-twice
quoteText: If you don't have time to do it right, you don't have time to do it twice.

title: donate-new
quoteText: Donate something you don't use every time you buy something new.

title: dont-know-honesty
quoteText: Learn to say "I don't know" when you don't. It's a sign of honesty, not weakness.

quoteText: When in doubt, overdress- not to impress others, but to honor the occasion.

title: early-help
quoteText: If you show up early, offer to help.

quoteText: It is so much easier to just be early than to try to be on time.

title: easier-prevent-fix
quoteText: Most problems are easier to prevent than to fix.

title: effort-friendships
quoteText: The older you get, the more effort it takes to maintain friendships—be the one who reaches out.

quoteText: When an elderly person tells a story, listen-even if it's one you've heard before.

title: embrace-failure
quoteText: Embrace failure as essential steps on the path to learning and growing.

title: emergency-fund
quoteText: An emergency fund can change a major crisis into a minor inconvenience.

title: encourage-creativity
quoteText: Creativity should always be encouraged. Judgement comes later.

title: entitled
quoteText: Feeling entitled is a quick way to finding

title: eta-add-hour
quoteText: Add an hour to your ETA-two if traveling with kids or pets.

title: experiences-not-things
quoteText: Invest in experiences, not just things. Memories outlast most possessions.

title: extra-charger
quoteText: Be a hero. Keep an extra charger in your bag.

title: fail-quickly
quoteText: The best outcome is to succeed. The next best is to fail quickly.

title: family-photo
quoteText: When you see someone taking a family photo, offer to take it so they can be in the picture.

quoteText: When a family member gets sick, your world gets a whole lot smaller.

title: favor-micromanage
quoteText: If someone is doing you a favor, don't micromanage how they do it.

title: feel-like-it
quoteText: Stop waiting to ‘feel like it.' Action creates motivation.

title: financial-docs
quoteText: Understand how to read a balance sheet, and income and cash flow statements.

title: first-reaction
quoteText: Your first reaction to something stressful is often your worst one.

title: fitted-sheet

quoteText: Keep a flashlight next to your bed-power outages don't wait for you to find your phone.

title: flossing
quoteText: Your future self will not be mad at you for flossing.

title: food-app-tip
quoteText: Don't let the food delivery app decide your tip.

title: forgive-generously
quoteText: Forgive generously.

title: free-customer-product
quoteText: If an app is free, you're not the customer-you're the product.

title: fresh-coat-of-paint
quoteText: A fresh coat of paint can fix almost anything.

title: fresh-garlic
quoteText: When a recipe calls for fresh garlic, don't substitute garlic powder.

title: friend-song-listen
quoteText: If a friend plays a song for you, listen like it matters. Because it does.

quoteText: Don't treat your empathetic friends like they're your therapist.

quoteText: If you borrow a car, return it with a full tank of gas.

quoteText: Write thank-you notes before they feel overdue.

title: garage-sales

quoteText: The garbage tells you when it needs to be taken out

quoteText: The best gift you can give someone is your full attention.

quoteText: Learn what it takes to maintain a good credit score.

title: gratitude-daily
quoteText: Practice gratitude, daily.

title: group-chat-midnight
quoteText: Nothing good happens in a group chat after midnight.

quoteText: Just because you'd feel guilty saying ‘no' doesn't mean you should say ‘yes'.

title: handshake

title: handwritten-note
quoteText: A handwritten note can mean much more than a text or email.

title: hangers-turn

title: hero-courage

title: hold-door

title: hold-scissors
quoteText: When handing scissors to someone, hold them by the sharp end.

title: home-safe

title: honest-capacity
quoteText: Be honest with yourself about your actual capacity.

title: house-key
quoteText: Always keep an extra house key somewhere safe.

title: hug-kids
quoteText: Hug kids after discipline-so they remember the love.

title: imagine-think

quoteText: The fastest way to improve your day is to make someone else's day better.

title: inner-voice

title: introduce-interesting
quoteText: Learn how to introduce yourself in an interesting way.

title: investing-do-nothing
quoteText: The hardest part of investing... is doing nothing.

title: invite-to-learn

title: jacket

title: job-interview-sketchy
quoteText: If a job feels sketchy in the interview, it won't get better.

title: just-show-up
quoteText: Don't offer "Let me know if you need anything."

quoteText: If you keep waiting for the ‘perfect time,' you'll wait forever. Just start.

title: kareoke
quoteText: Always have a go-to karaoke song.

quoteText: Keep in touch with your friends, they want to hear from you.

title: know-care
quoteText: Nobody cares how much you know until they know how much you care.

quoteText: Never eat the last cookie.

title: late-reply
quoteText: A late reply is better than no reply.

quoteText: If someone shows you a meme, laugh, even if you've seen it before.

title: leave-better

title: lights-off

quoteText: Support your local high school and community theatre. . ; : ro

quoteText: When bringing drinks to a party, always bring more ice than you think you'll need.

quoteText: The person who asks the most questions in the conversation walks away the most liked.

title: nice-dishes

quoteText: When you feel you need to race to catch up, try to remember this is not actually a race.

quoteText: Never let anyone tell you they are not creative. Never tell yourself you are not creative.

title: not-every-storm

title: pamplemousse
quoteText: Pamplemousse is the definitive flavor of LaCroix.

title: pay-yourself-first
quoteText: Pay yourself first.

title: perfect-loved
quoteText: You don't have to be perfect to be loved.

quoteText: Assemble yourself a personal board of advisors—trusted folks you can lean on for life's big calls. =i)

title: pet-attention

quoteText: If a pet trusts someone, that tells you something. If they don't, that tells you something too.

title: phones-dinner

quoteText: A curated playlist is an intimate invitation into someone's world.

title: problem-focus
quoteText: Your most valuable work each day is choosing the right problem to focus on.

title: quarter-tank

title: read-the-book

title: remember-birthdays
quoteText: Be known for remembering people's birthdays.

quoteText: When renting cars, splurge on models you'd love to try but never plan to own.

quoteText: Offer to pay back once, if they decline, don't insist. Sincerely say ‘thank you'.

title: restart-router
quoteText: If the Wi-Fi isn't working, try restarting the router before complaining.

title: return-promptly
quoteText: Return anything you borrow-and do so promptly.

title: run-late

title: running–toilet
quoteText: Learn basic plumbing fixes. Know how to stop D a running toilet

quoteText: Just because something is on sale doesn't mean you need it.

title: sand-castles
quoteText: Build sand castles on the beach.

title: sarcasm-lands
quoteText: Sarcasm seldom lands the way you think it will.

title: saving–today
quoteText: By saving today you are giving yourself options tomorrow.

title: say-hello-first
quoteText: Be the first to say hello-it sets the tone.

title: say-their-name

title: scent-feel-put-together
quoteText: Wear a scent that makes you feel put together.

title: self-compassion
quoteText: Be kind to yourself, self-compassion is a strength not a weakness.

title: sew-button

title: signature–app

title: small-wins

quoteText: A smile can brighten someone's day.

quoteText: Smoking doesn't make a statement anymore—it just shortens the story.

title: spell-check
quoteText: Check your spelling before hitting send.

title: stay-multi-lingual

quoteText: When cooking, always stick to the recipe the first time.

title: stretching

title: take-stairs

title: take-the-photo
quoteText: When in doubt, take the photo.

title: talking-loudest

title: teach-class
quoteText: Teach a class on a subject you know well.

title: tell-matter
quoteText: Tell the people who matter to you that they matter.

title: text-parents-back

title: thank-you-service

title: thank-yous-promptly
quoteText: Write thank-you notes before they feel overdue.

title: throw-box-away

title: time-over-money

title: time-precious
quoteText: Time with others is finite and precious.

title: tin-foil

title: tip-generously
quoteText: Tip generously.

title: toddler-phone
quoteText: When a toddler hands you a toy phone, you answer it.

title: track-happy
quoteText: Start tracking what actually makes you happy.

title: trash-advice
quoteText: If you wouldn't take advice from someone, don't take criticism from them either.

title: travel-early-often

title: travel-empathy
quoteText: Traveling abroad builds empathy for other cultures.

title: treat-animals
quoteText: The way people treat animals tells you a lot about them.

title: trust-feeling
quoteText: If something feels off-even if can't explain why-still trust that feeling.

title: turn-off-high-beams
quoteText: Turn off high beams for oncoming cars.

title: two-dogs

title: two-minutes
quoteText: If it takes less than two minutes, do it now.

title: two-options
quoteText: If choosing between two options feels impossible, they're probably both fine.

title: use-wit
quoteText: Use your wit to light up a room, not to own it.

title: vinegar-baking-soda
quoteText: White vinegar and baking soda can clean almost anything.

quoteText: Visit the landmarks in your own city just like a tourist would.

quoteText: When walking with someone, match their pace.

title: what-do-you-do

title: whisper-dont
quoteText: If you have to whisper it, you probably shouldn't.

quoteText: Word puzzles will keep your mind sharp.

title: worrying-interest
quoteText: Worrying is just paying interest on a problem you don't even have yet.

title: worth-more
quoteText: You will never be worth more than you think you are worth.
